posts.name: Gavin
posts.cooked: Hello, I am new to coding and encountered an error while trying to deploy the code. The error message shows the command `gradlew deploy` with arguments `-PteamNumber=61` and `--offline`, along with the environment variable `org.gradle.java.home` set to `"C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk"`. I need help figuring out why this happened and how to fix it.

posts.name: Brennan Bibic
posts.cooked: There should be more information about the actual error above these lines.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: 4476 Drive Coach | SLFF The Breakfast Company

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: That’s fairly clear. It’s unable to communicate with the RoboRIO. How are you currently connected (via wireless, wired Ethernet (to radio or Rio), or via wired USB)?

posts.name: Gavin
posts.cooked: I connected to the radio via Wi-Fi and the Rio using Ethernet and USB ports, encountering the same recurring issue every time.
Might be a firewall issue with your laptop not letting you push your code to the robot.

posts.name: Gavin
posts.cooked: Public, private, and domain firewalls being turned off is there anything else that needs to be changed?

posts.name: Carter Ryba
posts.cooked: The team number is set on the Rio.

posts.name: Gavin
posts.cooked: I’m unsure whether I’ll check it tomorrow, do you set that in the Roborio imaging tool?

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: The imaging tool should work, and the team number setter tool that comes with the WPILib installer also functions properly.

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked:
Task: discoverroborio  
Discovering Target roborio  
 admin @ 10.0.61.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException  
 Discovery timed out.  
 admin @ 172.22.11.2: Resolved but not connected. Reason: TimeoutException  
 Discovery timed out.  
 admin @ roborio-61-FRC FIRST Robotics Competition .lan: Failed resolution. Reason: RuntimeException  
 Unknown Host  
 admin @ roborio-61-FRC FIRST Robotics Competition .frc-field.local: Failed resolution  

This section of the error shows that the rio can be seen via the USB address 172.22.11.2. But, it cannot connect. It also shows that it cannot resolve (see) it at roborio-61-FRC FIRST Robotics Competition .lan.  

These two errors point to the team number not being correctly entered, or entered at all, on the rio, as mentioned in previous posts.

posts.name: Gavin
posts.cooked: Thank you for helping me. The SD card was not imaged correctly with my team number on it.
